title: Understand Variable Comparisons
text: Remember, when you're comparing dates or amounts within a SQL statement, make sure you're checking if one thing is either less than or greater than another. You do this by using the < or > operators.

title: Combine Conditions with AND
text: To meet both criteria at once (date before a certain day and amount greater than a value), you'll need to use the AND operator.

title: Combining Both Conditions
text: How do you combine the two conditions: one for the date and another for the amount, to ensure both must be true for the record? A specific keyword used to ensure multiple conditions are true.
